reviews.text: Helpful staff at the station, always very friendly and willing to assist with any enquires. A very good place for railway enthusiasts as well to enjoy the hobby responsibly and safely.
Small but beautiful station. Kind of open and chilling but has washroom in basement which also connects to the otherside of station. Architecht and ambience is interesting and staff is supportive.
Nice station, Friendly staff and regular trains to Manchester, and London and Scotland

We are very grateful to the staff at Wigan station who took care of our disabled daughter during yesterday's problems at the station. It is a shame the caring, hard-working staff were subjected to abuse and intolerance by impatient travellers when they were doing their best to sort alternate transportation for their customers.

The train was on time but then the stop I was suppose to get of at was cancelled and there was no announcement saying it was cancelled, so me and my 15 year old sister were lost. After that, me and my sister had to get of but my younger sister got stuck on the train and the rail man was very rude and sarcastic.Once we were both off the train the ticket office man was very rude and saying I was lying about the train being cancelled. Fortunately, there was another train going to we’re I needed to go and I got home.
